A date, a meeting—an agreed upon time in which two or more people agree to meet up at some place. Doesn’t carry any business or romantic connotations (the difference between a date and a meeting in English), an agd̦a is simply any agreement to meet.

To be close to something or someone, either physically or emotionally — [X acs Y.LOC → X is close to Y]

ety: From Proto-Thellian *laga, from Proto-Vinnic *lagdia. The verbalized form originates from the archaic causative marker *n…(ʔ)a which would’ve yielded *nlagdiaʔa, used in combination with *he:l (to draw from, to glean) in the expression *nlagdiaʔa he:l (to draw or obtain milk from). Over time, *he:l fell out of use in the expression reminiscent of a form of clipping, and *nlagdiaʔa experienced changes whereby the final /ʔa/ suffix was lost, /nl/ simplified to /n/, and /gd/ was lenited to /ɣ/, yielding *naɣia. In varieties of the language spoken by agricultural folk in rural communities — given the more common use of the word — *naɣia would evolve faster, yielding *naja → neja and eventually → ne:a. In fact, in urban areas, it is still common to hear the more archaic form naɣa.
notes: Inflection-bearing stem lá → singular ergative lál (not *lağğ, *lag)
(verbalized form) Inflection-bearing stem né- → second person singular present tense form néz (not *néaz)

ety: From Aman ṭṭatt’ (to nibble, to snack on)

senses.def: (by extension, of the weather) To be hot
(transitive) To taste, to try (food or drink)
(intransitive) To drive a car, to drive around
(linguistics) A modifier — encompasses both of the aforedefined categories
To do something again, to pick up (again)
(internal causative form þes) To undo, to go back on something, to change one’s mind
A distinct element of something larger — a segment, a part, a piece of
(Kuttar) A sector — region within a large neighborhood
A fraction of a whole, a component; a chamber
(by extension) A share of a stock
(by extension) A part — generally translated as a section — of a document, though not typically a chapter
(poetic) A thread, a string, a rope
❖ Málégalısz en enarða ólt irvíi má öszdþræða — It is illegal to water your lawn during a period of rain (while it is raining)

eg: Várzte mér ukzrasktíkár? — How do you spell your name?

senses.def: (nominalized form ukzraska) The spelling (of a word), a word’s spelling
To have a stroke of genius, to have an epiphany (no religious connotation)
To force through, to push through forcefully, to break (through), to break in
(with patient in the dative) To intimidate
To express, communicate; to make known or explicit

notes: Inflection-bearing stem ú → second person singular present úsz (not *újasz)

senses.def: To relax, to take time for oneself (akin to a cow's grazing)

ety: From Aeros yppit (to travel in a direction)

senses.def: To react in a certain way

eg: Í vúð úğrastu mriðag? — Am I making you feel sick? – Strangers by Ethel Cain

senses.def: To show, to demonstrate, to illustrate [someone • dative; something • absolutive]
Mis jed̦ útrýt in̦i bjá miste! — My cat looks like yours!
Nature, greenery, forestry, trees, shrubs, bushes

Any form of speech that is thought of as a variety of a common language. Under this term, British English and American English along with more divergent pairs like Swedish and Danish can be considered valodin of each-other. Encompasses the English meanings of dialect, variety, accent, regional variety, etc.
To go somewhere (not necessarily implying a return trip)
(agentive form valumarri) A pedestrian, someone walking on foot
To know — to be aware of something, to have been made aware of something
To teach [recipient in the dative, topic in the instrumental]
❖ Sinust ig arvissa varí — He’s the one who taught me math.
(agentive form varri) An expert, a specialist, a leading expert within a field
(adjective) Only, only one — alone in a category
(expression) Just saying, this is just to say, by the way
A girl, a woman, a female human
(-astr form várzastr) A probability, a chance, a likelihood (that)
❖ Mér ti vá? — What is your name?
❖ Forgoro vá — My name is Forgoro
(bivalent) To sneak in, to do something hiddenly
Thought to come from *v- (see vkrazką) + ela—gemination and relationship with the -ha suffix is unclear
❖ Vnau vellahu sunnalótte — Pick up your toys!
Ready [“ready for” is expressed as “ready because” (veszd ģa), with the complement in the dative case]
A preparatory school — the last school Kuttaris go to before university
A republic — a state where sovereignty rests with the people or their representatives, rather than with a monarch or emperor; a country with no monarchy.
❖ Món mnau vkrazkal adad̦ih venna saulla — I had to memorize an entire poem for school
(agentive form vërerri or the irregular verri) A vendor, a salesman
To detect, to perceive, to spot, to scan

Typically translated as warmth. Has to do with anything warm, comforting, beautiful, lovely, physically close, or peaceful — it is often idiomatically used to translate concepts such as light or sunshine and can be used as a verb meaning to hug, to cuddle, or to just be physically close to someone in some way. Vintur can be a hot bath in winter, a mug of hot chocolate, a huge sweater, big blankets, an apple pie, et cetera.
A seer — used in all kinds of derivations relating to eyesight as will be listed below
A store, a shop, a market
(time) By — not after a certain time
❖ Luczu usalas vís intasjá — I’d prefer if you got home by (no later than) midnight
Expression: Karma always comes back [literally Gente mierda, llega un punto que la mierda embarra]

ety: From Proto-Tellic *kraskan (to recall) with the (no longer productive) segmentative prefix *v-, from Proto-Vinnic *r̥askan, equivalent to *r̥aska + *-n (infinitive suffix)

senses.def: ❖ Séruð máhéslalaj vkrasze — The band rehearsed for their performance
(with subject in the dative case, direct object in the instrumental) To memorize
❖ Món mnau vkrazkal adad̦ih venna saulla  — I had to memorize an entire poem for school
(figurative) A place of rest, a space for meditation
(with direct object in the genitive) To take a bite out of something
To do, to carry out some task
To log, to write an entry (book or journal)
(adjectivized ylgs or ygs) Maternal, relating to the mother’s side of the family
To receive, to get, to obtain
An island — contiguous land surrounded by water
The formatting (of a document), the layout
To format, to organize, to typeset
A snake, a python, a viper
(expression, of some event) To go well, to be successful [literally A python ate its ass]
(diminutive zlil) A fry, a french fry
Expression of terror, awe, surprise, astonishment — literally 'Fried dick'
To be firm, to hold one’s ground (intransitive)
To put oneself first — to take care of oneself before worrying about others (intransitive, by extension)

eg: Ernu al — I’m minding my own business
Vúð has ernu! — Mind your business!

senses.def: To subject oneself to, to force oneself to experience something, to face [with subject in the dative, complement preceded by í and in the instrumental case]
A subject of an intransitive verb; the sole subject, an experiencer (by extension, linguistics)
(causative form eğrn) To force someone to do something
An experience (usually negative, zero-nominalized, by extension)
To wait, to wait around, to be waiting (by extension, intransitive)
Expected, understandable (deverbal adjective of the previous definition ernið)
To make sense (intransitive, zero-verbalized use of the previous definition)
To acknowledge the existence or legality of; to treat as valid or worthy of consideration (transitive)
A position (on a topic), a standpoint, a stance (zero-nominalized)
To graze, to touch gently or softly
(with recipient in the dative, direct object in the instrumental) To give; to transmit
eg: I gave him a book

senses.def: (deverbal enid, law) A provision — a formal statement in a legal or regulatory text that gives or grants a right, duty, exception, or requirement
(diminutive imid) A fact, a piece of knowledge
(prefix ern-) Used on verbs to show that the speaker truly intends or is wishing for something to happen
(expression) To be speechless; I don’t know what to say [literally I am a table]
(collective evënia) Winds, wind (when talking about things like the North wind, et cetera)
To hear, to be able to perceive something auditorily
(adverb) In order to, with the goal of
For oneself, to do [x] for oneself [fesz + pronoun + verb]
eg: Mınnuhvu ti fesz ti kjar — It would allow you to decide for yourself

senses.def: To present, to introduce, to bring forward, to bring into light, to reveal
A chicken (in the most basic sense)
(linguistics, of vowels) Quality — a vowel’s quality: a measure of factors such as frontness, height, nasality, et cetera.
The ancient Germanic people, the Teutons
(-gs form germags, linguistics) Germanic — the group of Indo-European languages that developed from (Ur-)Germanic
A grain (of sand, dust, etc), a speck, a drop of (some liquid)
To live (in a place), to inhabit, to reside
Local — from or in a nearby location
(of fog) To be currently in process — to be in foggy weather, to fog (analogous to “to rain”)
❖ Glömíhum gár alta — It was foggy last night.

notes: Always used with the noun in the singular form

senses.def: (suffix) Multiple, many of — reinforces the sense that there are not only one of a noun
The base, the core of something, the most basic part of it
(with underlying tu after, modern-day spelling cad) Because of [dative]; as a result (of)

word: Cad ádau úir májan á bumba
notes: Replace áðau with the relevant noun or pronoun in the dative case

senses.def: (expression) To be a player [literally To have the cows going home saying moo]
(deverbal ğid) The former, aforementioned, previously stated, said

notes: Prefix. If the word starts with a coronal consonant, the l assimilates to it (follows Arabic sun-moon rules)

senses.def: Indicates what something is made from (cooking) or based on in general
Indicates what something is meant to be used for
eg: Szí rasoir bıl-kúk szrba — This is a razor (meant) for bald roosters

senses.def: But you know, mais bon, enfin bref
The mind; the non-material substance or set of processes in which consciousness, perception, affectivity, judgement, thinking, and will are based (capacity for rational thought, memory, et cetera)
(colloquial) The trick to, the secret to

Yun — the sticky green paste obtained from grinding Blokoli roots, a sort of tuber that grows just about anywhere in Kuttar so long as the soil is moist. This makes some roots quite tough to work with, especially like the ones around the coal mines in Sector H since the soil is extremely hard. Optionally, some yunmakers choose to add spices like cajun, lavender, curry, and even saffron for the fanciest of them. This paste is then formed into a ball before being steamed with water as hot as your stove can go to give it its key texture, which is then applied to one’s hair as an aesthetic marker. Kuttaris take this very seriously.
(verbalized form szhid) To saddle, to put a saddle on

notes: Usage 2 is similar to ven acá in Cuban Spanish]

senses.def: (interjection) By the way; indicates that the speaker wants to know more about something, specifically about which the listener is expected to know about particularly more than the average person (say, gossip)
(verb) To come, to arrive; to approach, to come closer
(linguistics) A subject of a transitive verb — an agent
(linguistics) A direct object; an object of a transitive verb — a patient
To work out, to be successful, to successfully [x]; to succeed
(interjection, hedge) You know, but you know; used to imply meaning, also to conclude a sentence after what the speaker determines to be too long of a statement or explanation
Actual, real; indeed, the one being talked about
eg: A morgos. Vársz ca ispzaru mitrin biá id ⟨sz⟩ ie ⟨rz⟩ — psvalodad á vöda. İ monnin ruskimın, a emiastr kettö.

senses.def: (countable) Advice, a piece of advice, a tip
To advise, to give advice, to suggest
A boy, a man, a male human
(preposition) Instead of, in place of, rather than, in lieu of
(ğsël, intransitive) To take a bath, to bathe
(expression) Cut him some slack [literally laisse le chier sur un chameau un peu]
(Kuttar) A Traitory — any restaurant in Kuttar other than GMS (excluding supermarkets and such)

senses.def: The main section of something — the body of
(measures of space) Volume — a three-dimensional measure of space that comprises a length, a width and a height
An ancestor (an earlier type of something — a progenitor)
eg: Rocc-Vinn — țajg ugenakár amma valodind Liți je Telja, ciszda bannam Kterze — Proto Vinnic is the common ancestor of all Lithic and Thellian languages, the latter branch of which Kterze belongs to.

notes: May also be spelt c̦esze to reflect pronunciation or cesze

senses.def: Very, really, to a large extent
(colloquial) To read; to be reading books
To flip through the pages of a book
To make a mistake; to falter
(time) For a long time, a while
To gift — to give something as a gift to [someone • dative]

ety: From Darija trmt l-xiṭ (le cul du fil)

senses.def: (colloquial) At the end; the end of something, an ending

ety: Loaned from an Indo-European, likely Romance, language

senses.def: A bear, typically a brown bear
(expression) To do something in the completely wrong way; to have something all backwards [literally To walk on one's shoulders]
To shave (one's facial or bodily hair)
Latin — the language of the Romans
A suspicious or sussy person — someone you might not initially trust or have suspicions about
A piece of something, little fragment; unstructured piece of smt (like a piece of paper)
цецхлъи — țețxli [t͡st͡sʀ̩̊li] or țechțli; țëțchli țțëchli, böyur, aran, tal
